text:
- He's very, very good.
- And very, very cute.

Whatever.
You were all thinking it.
♪ I hit the gas ♪
♪ I've got perfect practice ♪
♪ I won't get distracted ♪
♪ I know what I want ♪
♪ And I want it all ♪
♪ I'm ready for anything ♪
( music continues )

I need to get out of here.
Immediately.

- Oof!
- ( music stops )

- Woman: Oh, come on.
- What?

- What's going on?
- I'm so sorry.
I'll plug it back in. Um--

- Are you okay?
- Yeah.
You sure you're not hurt?

- Just my ego.
- Well, don't worry.

I got my CPR, first aid,
all that stuff.

- I'm fine, I swear.
- You might have a concussion.

Just take off your hat
and sunglasses.

Now look into my eyes.
What color are they?

- Brown with golden flecks?
- Okay.

Why can't I get trolled by
someone who looks like this?
Now follow my finger.

Okay, I don't think
you have a concussion.
But if you feel sick,

definitely check in
with your doctor.
Thanks.

Wait a minute.
Do I know you?

- No, I don't think so.
- Uh, Holly? We should go.

They're about to announce
the winners.

Holly Hobbie.
I saw your video.

What are you doing
in Sheffield?
Well, if you must know,

I came to see you,
Oscar Moreno.
Or should I say "Savvy08"?

Was that supposed to be
a big "a-ha" moment?

Holly:
So this is your cover?

Amazing musician/
first responder by day,

- mean online troll by night?
- I'm not a troll.

But you wrote a rude comment
about my song.

I was just pointing out
that if someone writes a song

about all the drama
they went through,

they probably shouldn't
call the song "Over It."

"Over it" means
you've moved on, right?
See? That was rude.

Well, for the record,
I liked your song.
The music part of the song.
The lyrics...

If you think I'm going to take
music advice from a bully,

then you've got
another thing coming.
So you think I'm a bully?
Your comment was very critical.

Bullying is when
you intend to hurt,

so tell me who's
the bigger bully.

The one who writes
a slightly critical comment

or the one who personally
attacks someone with their song?
I wasn't trying to be a bully.
Look, no! She did it first.

I was just trying
to defend myself, I guess.
Two wrongs don't make a right.

Look, I probably shouldn't
have embarrassed you like that,

but you do got to take
some responsibility.
Speaking of responsibility,

I should probably
get back at it.

Hey, just promise me
you'll take it easy, okay?

Thanks for all
your excellent medical care.

Now could you stop
being so nice?
I thought I was rude?
